Note.Name: Range
Note.Text:
We mask the Range node with the gradient to create distinct slope.
In Post Process, we control the height with Autolevel + Clamp, and Shaper is used to bulk up the landscape.

Note.Name: Gradient
Note.Text: This basic slope will help us modulate the Range node.

Note.Name: Rugged
Note.Text: Rugged is used to add rocky subtractions to the landscape.

Note.Name: Wizard
Note.Text: We use Fast Erosion in Wizard to add erosion to the terrain.

Note.Name: Rugged
Note.Text: The same Rugged settings are duplicated so the subtractions can be made stronger.

Note.Name: Constant
Note.Text: A full height constant that will be used for subtraction.

Note.Name: Rugged
Note.Text: Rugged adds rugged details to the flat constant. Then it is inverted in Post Process to create subtraction-friendly shape.

Note.Name: Combine
Note.Text: We subtract the inverted Rugged from the main terrain using a height mask.

Note.Name: Height
Note.Text: We mask out the lower heights for the Combine node.
